repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam is a narrative telling the legend of Vaḷḷi, the consort of Murukaṉ. It appears to be an epitome of the Kantapurāṇam (Taylor 1845, p. 61).
The text is complete, with 67 caṟukkams (Skt. sarga) and 1422 stanzas (U2, f115v6‒7).

collation.desc: 1 folio = title page. No foliation.Verso blank. Hand #1.
1 folio = table of contents. Tamil foliation 115.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, considering the age of the manuscript and in spite of some bore holes caused by insects.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Edouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Edouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).
